detailed_info.name: Dehydroacetic acid
detailed_info.description: Dehydroacetic acid is used in cosmetics as a preservative for its fungicidal and bactericidal actions. It is used under the name E265 in food. As it is biodegradable, this chemical does not pose a problem for the environment, and the health risks remain quite low. Note, however, that the compound is prohibited in aerosol type sprays. Dehydroacetic acid is authorized in Bio.
detailed_info.regulation:
The maximum concentration allowed in ready-to-use cosmetic preparations is
0.6% (in acid).
It is forbidden to use it in aerosol type sprays

functions.name: Preservative
functions.description: Inhibits the development of microorganisms in cosmetic products.
